content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I could definitely see this puzzle in a Clash of Code round.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I feel its great for beginners

- To be explicit, I would suggest rephrasing "greatest percentage of characters in lower case" as:

You must find the string containing the <<greatest percentage of lowercase English alphabetical characters ({{a}}-{{z}})>>. This percentage is calculated by dividing the total number of lowercase English alphabetical characters by the total number of characters in the string, including whitespace and special characters.

- Please add more test cases with longer strings to better match your provided constraints.

- I would reject Reverse mode as there is no way I would personally be able to guess the rule given the current test cases. Even if I were to guess the rule, I would still be confused over how to handle tiebreaks since I wouldn't be able to see the constraints. But that's just my opinion.

Basing the clash on guessing a formula is a bad idea for a Reverse mode clash. In addition, the clash currently lacks any key programming elements such as lists, sets, dictionaries, string manipulation, loops, conditions…

Please add one or more programming elements so that the clash is more of a programming problem than a maths problem.

Thanks.

Ok, I understood your comments.

Therefore, I updated it to have more programming elements. For these reasons, the title was updated too and the 3 modes should be possible.

Ok, I removed the reverse mode.
I updated the goal as written by you.
And I added a test with two longer sentences.

Nice, thank you.

As a side note, if you want to generate test cases with long phrases / sentences, you could consider lorem ipsum generators (e.g. https://loremipsum.io/).
@celeria, please update the second constraint as it's violated by Test 5 and Validator 5. Thanks.
I updated with 256 for the max length of string.

Thank you. That's a better idea than before.

Would you please follow up as follows?

Input
* Please change "Ligne" to "Line".

Output
* Please change "a string, the good one" to "The string with the greatest percentage of characters in lower case".

Constraints
* Please add:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
1 ≤ length of a string ≤ 100
It is guaranteed that there will be exactly one string with the greatest percentage of lower case characters.

Cases
* Please remove the trailing newlines from the input of the cases below:
  • Test 1
  • Test 2

Game modes
* I'm not so sure about Reverse mode, but let's wait and see what others think.

Thanks.
